comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: An educated guess: The top end of Mosman Bay looking west from roughly where now is the corner of Avenue Road and Millett Road, Mosman. The tidal flats were filled in and landscaped about 1900 (see all the references to Mosman waterfalls). The Park Avenue waterfall is out of sight behind the pale rock. According to the Rangers Estate map www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-lfsp1643-sd . there should be another waterfall at the head of the bay right of this photo, near the end of Millett Road. There are (channel?) marker posts in the water and white-painted marker posts. The fence around the trees (why?) is also in this photo www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3195835022/ . Taken at a similar location, but with a large group of people.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I am dubious about the Mosman theory,  because the top end of Cremorne point was not completely undisturbed forest by then.
